The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It has a distinctive bark that is smooth and greyish, and its leaves are usually opposite and oval in shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Meryta balansae is considered a rare and endangered species.
